tn.ref: So all Israel was recorded in genealogies
tn.text: A genealogy refers to a record of a family descendants or a persons ancestors.

tn.ref: the Book of the Kings of Israel
tn.text: This refers to a book that no longer exists.
This is the name of a people group descended from Shelah. It is a spelling variation for the Shelanites.

tn.ref: They were very capable men in the work in the house of God
tn.text: AT: "These capable men worked in the house of God"
This is the name of a people group.

tn.ref: they stood guard at the king's gate on the east side for the camp of Levi's descendants
tn.text: "Levi's descendants guarded the king's gate on the east side of their camp"

tn.ref: the door to the tent ... the entrance
tn.text: These phrases both refer to the entrance of the tent of meeting, or the tabernacle.

tn.ref: Their names were recorded in the people's records in their villages
tn.text: AT: "The records in peoples' villages included the names of these men" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: on all four sides, toward the east, west, north, and south
came in for seven-day rotations, in turn
tn.text: day rotations, in turn** - AT: "would come to help for 7-day periods, taking turns" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])

tn.ref: were assigned to guard the rooms
they counted the articles when they were brought in and when they were taken out
tn.text: AT: "they counted the articles that people took out to use, and they counted the articles when people brought them back"

tn.ref: were assigned to take care of

tn.text: These are names of people groups.
See the Translation Word page about "bread" for the specific definition of "bread of the presence."
AT: "they did not have to do other work" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: had to carry out their assigned tasks
tn.text: AT: "had to complete their assigned task"
This means "at all times" and can be translated using a phrase or word from your language or culture that gives the same meaning. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_merism]])

tn.ref: These were family leaders among the Levites, as listed in their genealogical records
tn.text: AT: "The family history lists included the names of these Levite family leaders"
The first reference to Gibeon is to the person but the second reference to Gibeon is the city.
